titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Time Inc. Printing Developments, Inc. Ledgers MS 3009.RG 22
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Holly Deakyne and Melanie Rinehart
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-04-18T09:37-0400

did.unittitle: Time Inc. Printing Developments, Inc. Ledgers
did.abstract: Includes the ledgers of Printing Developments, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Time Inc., that manufactured and marketed technological products and services related to printing.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Contains Printing Developments, Inc.'s business ledgers.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: The Printing Developments, Inc. Ledgers were processed by Holly Deakyne in 2017. Deakyne housed the loose ledgers in folders and rearranged. Deakyne and Melanie Rinehart created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Printing Developments, Inc. Ledgers (MS 3009.RG 22), The New-York Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Printing Developments, Inc. was a wholly-owned subsidiary of Time Inc. Established in 1950, it manufactured and marketed technological products and services related to printing developed by Time Inc.'s Springdale, Connecticut research lab.
